data.text: @wildrosemage I can’t say my lungs will ever be the same, it’s nightmarish stuff.
@wildrosemage Any disclaimers on the box the masks came in?

@wildrosemage Headaches / migraine, some days difficulty breathing, tired, brain fog, dizziness, etc. Not all the time but they show up regurarly. What other stuff has happened to my body? It's really really scary to just don't know and get 0 recognition in what you've been through.

@wildrosemage This scares the living hell out of me, was heavily infected in march 2020, not tested or anything as i was still "healthy enough" not to go the the ER. Coughed up blood and wasn't able to leave the bed for days though... now i still have some lasting issues 1/

@wildrosemage Yeah, but we were put in the "normal" group in Norway, so I was in the very last group to get vaccinated 😬 
So far so good though!💪🏻✨
@Cha_C_San It's rare enough that most people wouldn't think about it or mention it, probably—and it's much easier to categorize everyone into "immunocompromised" and "normal." 🙄
@wildrosemage Genetic-blood-clot-disorder-five! And even covid gives a higher risk of blood clots I've not seen anyone mention us as higher risk :c

Don't know what else to say except keep wearing your (KN95 or N95) mask—enduring some strange looks is better than getting or spreading COVID. I just got these ones and they're much more comfortable than other N95 shapes I've worn.

https://t.co/8L5J334xGh

The scientific findings on blood clots discussed in this article affect me on a personal level; it confirms that a near relative and I are both at higher risk from COVID (+ complications) because of a genetic clotting disorder.

https://t.co/ShqIcwScFt

It's possible that some vaccines mitigate the long-term effects of COVID infection (or to put it in casual terms, vaccinated people might be less screwed by post-COVID health risks) but at this point there's no data one way or the other, so that would be hopeful speculation.
